channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Spring 2024 Dean’s Honor List Now Available
item.description: The Dean’s Honor list for Spring 2024 is now available for viewing on the Dean of Students Office’s website. This list is compiled at the end of each semester to recognize undergraduate students who have completed 12 or more credit hours at Rensselaer with a 3.5 grade point average or better for that term.
item.author: Community

item.title: Rensselaer Collegiate Store Holding Summer Sale Days July 16-17
item.description: The Rensselaer Collegiate Store will celebrate its Summer Sale Days on July 16 and July 17, with select merchandise 25% off in-store as well as online. Check out the Store’s website for more details!
item.author: Community

item.title: RPI Announces Fall 2024 Men’s Golf Schedule
item.description: Rensselaer has announced the fall 2024 men’s golf schedule, with the Engineers and Head Coach Matt McGarvey set for five competitions, beginning with The Gauntlet presented by Premiere College Tournaments at The Bucknell Golf Club on September 14 and 15.
item.author: Community

item.title: Call Issued for Projects Related to HPC-Quantum Workflow
item.description: To continue RPI’s and IBM’s collaborative HPC-Quantum integration efforts, proposals are being sought for projects with potential applications and use cases for the upcoming HPC-Quantum workflow. RPI’s Future of Computing Institute will hold a 9AM-noon workshop on July 24 in CII 3130; you may also attend via Webex. If you wish to present a project or have questions, contact Osama Raisuddin.
item.author: Community

item.title: Confluence Documentary Series Exposes Symbiotic Relationship Between the Arts and Sciences
item.description: At RPI, we believe that bridging the gap between art, science, and technology achieves the unparalleled innovation and creativity required to solve the complex problems of today’s world. Brought to you by The Priem Family Foundation – led by RPI alumnus and vice chair of the RPI Board of Trustees Curtis Priem ’82, and his wife, Cindi – Confluence is a three-part television series that shows how the arts and STEM combine to spark human creativity.
item.author: Community

item.title: Campus Community Invited to Cybersecurity Meetup with FBI, ISC2
item.description: Date: Wednesday, July 24, 2024 6:00 PM - 8:00 PM - All are welcome to join the Rensselaer Cybersecurity Collaboratory and DotCIO for the first meeting of the new ISC2 Capital District NY Chapter, which will host monthly engaging cybersecurity talks and opportunities to network with cybersecurity professionals from the Capital District and beyond. This month, Samantha Baltzersen, Supervisory Special Agent in Charge of Cyber for Albany FBI Field Office, will give a talk.
item.author: Community

item.title: Print Server Maintenance Scheduled for Evening of July 18
item.description: From approximately 6:00PM to 9:00PM on Thursday, July 18, DotCIO staff will be performing maintenance on the campus printing environment. As a result, there will be a brief outage that will affect all print jobs sent from a large number of printers around the Rensselaer campus.
item.author: Community

item.title: Quantum Computing Users Group Meeting
item.description: The Quantum Computing Users Group will meet on Wednesday, July 31st, from noon to 1 pm, in Amos Eaton 214. A number of our members are attending the IBM Qiskit Summer School. Their experiences and other topics the group is interested in will be discussed. Please join us! RSVP: Tom Morgan, morgat5@rpi.edu
item.author: Community

item.title: Summer Outdoor Program Series Continues with Overnight Canoe Camping at Forked Lake
item.description: Date: Friday, July 19, 2024 3:00 PM - Sun , July 21, 2024 2:00 PM - Students are invited to join the Mueller Center’s overnight canoe camping trip at Forked Lake! This trip is limited to eight participants and registration is required; please look for information and registration on the Muller Center’s Instagram page, or contact WillWeinert if you have questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: Registration Still Open for the Capital Region Basketball Camp at RPI!
item.description: Register now to enjoy the convenience of dropping your child off at a sports camp right where you work! Enrolled members with CDPHP can request a fitness reimbursement for this camp of up to $200 per plan year, for all covered dependents combined.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: Food Drive Being Held to Support New Campus Pantry
item.description:
Date: Monday, July 15, 2024 - Fri , July 19, 2024 (all day) - Stop by the Off-Campus Commons at 1515 15th street and donate canned and other non-perishable items to help support the campus’ new student food pantry! You can also arrange for food pickup or make a monetary donation.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
